The misleading video was shared on Faceb: Twitter, YouTube, and other platforms, gaining significant views and shares.
The claim is debunked by multiple source: including ABC News, NBC News, and the BBC, who reported on the incident and confirmed that no one can be heard saying "Allahu Akbar" in the video.
Additional videos and images from the ra: including a 1 hour 20-minute video and a photograph from AFP, also do not show any evidence of the phrase being shouted.
